section.heading: Purpose.
section.text: The purpose of this chapter is to establish a limit on the value of incentives offered by carriers in wellness programs.

section.heading: Scope.
section.text: This chapter applies only to the wellness programs as defined in Regulation .03 of this chapter, and Insurance Article, §27-210(h)(1), Annotated Code of Maryland.

para.text: In this chapter, the following terms have the meanings indicated.
“Wellness program” has the meaning stated in Insurance Article, §27-210(h)(1), Annotated Code of Maryland.

section.heading: Incentive Permitted.
section.text: A carrier may offer an incentive for participation in a wellness program if the incentive:

para.text: Is reasonably related to the wellness program; and
Does not have a value that exceeds any limit established by Regulation .05 of this chapter.

section.heading: Value of Incentive Offered.
section.text: An incentive offered for participation in a wellness program by a carrier may not have a value that exceeds $500 per year, per individual who is an insured, a subscriber, or a member.
